#summary How to install MediaNav server

= Introduction =

STILL IN PROGRESS

Steps to install MediaNav server

apt-get install python-django (needs version 1.1), might need to download latest version from django website
apt-get install python-mysqldb
apt-get install mediainfo (might only be in PPA repository)
https://launchpad.net/~shiki/+archive/mediainfo


= Details =

  * Configure your database
  * If using mysql, you can do mysqladmin create medianav
grant all privileges on medianav.* to 'medianav'@'localhost' identified by 'medianav';
  * copy settings.py.example to settings.py Edit settings.py

Change DATABASE_* settings

Edit MEDIANAV_TV_MEDIA = '/opt/medianav/media/img/tv';
MEDIANAV_MOVIES_MEDIA = '/opt/medianav/media/img/movies';

Run python manage.py syncdb

Create tables and user

Ok, you can now test if the webserver works
In another window, run python manage.py runserver 0.0.0.0:8000
(assuming you have port 8000 free)
Then open a browser to http://yourmachine:8000/medianav/
And see if it opens a page

python manage.py movie_scan_dir all
python manage.py movie_imdb_assoc all
